message:
Dears,
In the light of the recent security breaches I started to think about using password managers :( even though I really hate the idea of a  central place with all of the passwords
I wanted to know if you think it's a good idea to use a password manager or not ? Also is there a password manager that can change all of your passwords at once ?

data.message:
use a formula between the user name and the website instead
or
Use a password manager and save the passwords with extra character(s) or backwards ..etc
:D never use a password managers ! in case you been hacked you are dead !
If you need a password manager, I'd recommend using an offline password manager. Online is never a good idea when it comes to passwords.
Password managers are not a bad idea at all as long as you use offline ones.

Why not try one password?
It stores your passwords locally. 
Or the iCloud Keychain.

I prefer the following approch: create a pattern in your head that only you know, this pattern can generate a password using a hint (i.e. key) and store only the key. The pattern should be simple enough to remember but hard for any one to guess, maybe related to some very personal info that no one knows.
Couple your password manager with 2 factor authentication. Even access to you local password store should be using 2fa. Check yubico
Password pattern, and use forget my password if it happened and forget website password

I use password managers for all accounts except the most critical ones (My email and bank accounts). It becomes much easier to remember two or three unique and hard passwords when you offloaded all the not so critical accounts off of your head.
Security breaches could reach password managers too.

Try KeePass.. Lock its database with a random key file on your machine (recommended) and store passwords with suffix/prefix (optional)
http://security.stackexchange.com/a/58635

You should use password manager. I'd recommend 1Password https://agilebits.com and for more details about passwords   https://www.troyhunt.com/only-secure-password-is-one-you-cant/  finally register at https://haveibeenpwned.com to get notification when you account is breached
Another good read about password managers https://nakedsecurity.sophos.com/2016/07/19/why-you-should-use-a-password-manager/
